channel.title: open-source on μβ
channel.description: Recent content in open-source on μβ

item.title: JuliaStats/Distributions.jl
item.description: Contributions to the JuliaStats ecosystem, especially the Distributions.jl package for modeling probability distributions in Julia using a minimal and flexible interface.

item.title: YASPR: Yet Another Snake on Piston & Rust
JuliaGraphs contributions
item.description:
Starting from a weird Kaggle side-project during the Chrismas holidays, I gradually got involved in the JuliaGraphs ecosystem. After some discussion on the Julia Slack #graphs channel, I went from reporting a simple feature I needed to helping with the re-organization by splitting out two packages:

  • LightGraphsMatching.jl
  • LightGraphsFlows.jl

I also implemented the min-cost flow problem formulated as a linear optimization problem formulated using MathProgBase.jl, using any user-provided solver.

Many thanks to the whole JuliaGraphs team for their trust, support and advice.

item.title: WebFuncs
item.description:
WebFuncs.jl is a project testing the Julia language out of its natural scope. Having played quite a bit with Go and Python, I wanted to see if the Julia ecosystem had tools for HTTP handling.

The inspiration of a simple-to-use function server came from the fx project. Define your function, the package throws it as a server for you.

The package has been accepted on the Julia package repository and can be fetched using Pkg.add("WebFuncs").
